results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Shirley Barrett, Jan Chapman, AFFC and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description:
Two bored sisters, Dimity and Vicki-Ann, live in the small country town of Sunray. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered type, formerly star D.J. of a drive-time programme on Brisbane radio, threatens to turn the sisters’ world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for 70’s music and young women. Awards: Cannes International Film Festival 1996: Camera d’Or for Shirley Barrett. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Jan Chapman ; director, writer, Shirley Barrett ; photography, Mandy Walker.
Cast: Miranda Otto, Rebecca Frith, George Shevtsov, John Alansu.

results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Shirley Barrett, Jan Chapman, AFFC and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description: Two bored sisters Dimity and Vicki-Ann live in a small country town. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered radio personality arrives on the scene and threatens to turn their world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for ‘70’s music and young women. Awarded the Camera D’Or at the 1996 Cannes Film Festival and starring Miranda Otto and Rebecca Frith (as the love-torn sisters) alongside George Shevtsov and John Alansu. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Love on the wing
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: Continually metamorphosing symbols, drawn directly on 35mm film stock, move against multi-plane backgrounds. The film publicised the U.K. Air Mail service. Music by Jacques Ibert, camera by F. Gamagi.

results.title: Love on the run = L'Amour en fuite
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Films du Carrosse and AMLF
results.brief_description: Fifth and final installment of Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” cycle. Largely a series of flashbacks, this episode sees Antoine about to be divorced, and hence, reflective about his life. He is in love with Sabine but is filled with conflict about his responsibilities, in particular, his son, and is introspective the about the past. Aboard a train Antoine meets up with former love, Colette, and although they initially recall the past fondly, she subsequently berates Antoine for his lack of maturity and enduring self-absorption. This bittersweet work was largely derided as a disappointing end to an iconic series, but it maintains the lyricism and comical whimsy that are signatures of Truffauts “Doinel” work, whilst also being the most mediative.
results.title_for_label: Love on the run = L’Amour en fuite

results.title: Love on a slice of bread = Cinta dalam sepotong roti
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho, Budiyati Abiyoga and Prasidi Teta Film
results.brief_description: Director Garin Nugroho’s first feature is the story of three childhood friends caught in a love triangle. Topan, a photographer, visits his childhood friends who have married each other. The three of them end up travelling to Lombok together, which proves to be not such a good idea. The husband is revealed to be sexually incompetent and he ends up having an affair with Topan’s photographic model (although to what extent remains unclear as the film was censored by the Indonesian Censorship Board). Meanwhile, Mayang finds out that she has more in common with Topan than her husband. This is arguably Nugroho’s most mainstream effort. Later on, he went on to develop his hallmark strengths - intricate cultural nuances, sparse dialogue and a sense of hightened realism. This film won Best Film at the Indonesian Film Festival in 1991 and Best young Director at the Asia-Pacific Film Festival in South Korea in the same year. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Love of static sound
results.brief_description: A range of visual treatments including image within image and beat mixed editing creates a seductive and culturally revealing music video clip. Two characters are depicted using a high impact visual style with an underlying narrative.

results.title: Love of books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Brief glimpses into the work of British printers and bookmakers. The film shows the reading room of the British Museum; Oliver, the calligraphist and illuminator; Caxton’s first Chaucer; the binding and print in some 18th century volumes; publishers; children’s books and much more.

results.title: Love now pay later
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
An introductory description of the increasing incidence of venereal disease. A consultant surgeon of a London VD Clinic explains the range of causative factors.

results.title: Love nest
results.creator_credit: Joseph Newman, Jules Buck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When serviceman Jim Scott (William Lundigan) returns home after 2 1/2 years in the Army he finds his wife, Connie (June Haver), has bought a run down apartment block and assumed the role of landlady at 337 Grammercy Place. Eager to resume his writing, he soon learns that the landlord is always home, and with a suspected Casanova swindler as a tenant, and a jealous wife following the arrival of Jim’s beautiful Army buddy WAC Bobby (Marilyn Monroe), it will take something exceptional to get his writing off the ground and save the decrepit building from being condemned. Cast also includes Frank Fay, Leatrice Joy and Jack Parr. Based on the novel by Scott Corbett. Includes the original theatrical trailer.
